The following symbol(s) contain duplicate records: '%s'.

The table was set to read-only because the symbol contains duplicate records.

dialogJobSubmission.badName: Please choose a valid name for the new job.
dialogJobSubmission.successMsg: Your job was scheduled successfully. You can retrieve the results as soon as the job finished executing.

exceedMaxNoDialog.title: Maximum number scenarios exceeded
exceedMaxNoDialog.desc: You have selected to solve %s scenarios for your Hypercube run. This exceeds the maximum allowed number that can be solved per run (%s). Please reduce the number of scenarios and try again.

noScenSelectedDialog.desc: You first need to select at least one scenario that you want to solve.

badStepSizeDialog.title: Bad step size
badStepSizeDialog.desc: You specified a step size that could not be processed. Please select a valid step size and try again.

ttips.corruptedNoProcess: The job is terminated, but no results were found.

discardConfirm.title: Confirm discard
discardConfirm.desc: Are you sure you want to discard the selected job? Running jobs will be stopped.

newCompletedJobsDialog.title: New completed jobs

dialogBatchLoad.selectMethod: What would you like to do with the selected scenarios?

dialogBatchLoad.removeSuccess: The selected scenarios were removed successfully.
dialogBatchLoad.removeIncompleteError: Not all of the selected scenarios could be removed. This could be because they are read-only or have already been removed by someone else in the meantime.

duplicatedScenDialog.someDuplicated: %d of the scenarios you want to import already exist in the database with the tag(s): '%s'. Do you still want to proceed or only import those scenarios that do not yet exist.

errMsg.noScript: Script file could not be found.

migrationModule.title: Database migration
migrationModule.desc: We have determined that your GAMS/MIRO data contract has changed in a way that is incompatible with your app's current database layout. Please specify how your data should be migrated.
migrationModule.backupWarning: We strongly recommend that you backup your database before migration.
migrationModule.successMsg: Your data has been migrated successfully! Please restart the application.
migrationModule.incompatibleTypeWarning: The existing data must be cast to a numeric value to fit into the new database table. Values that cannot be converted become 0!

dialogConfirmDataLoss.title: Warning: Loss of data
dialogConfirmDataLoss.descTables: Attention: The following tables are removed with your current migration configuration: '%s'!
dialogConfirmDataLoss.descTableCols: Attention. The column(s): '%s' of the table: '%s' are removed with your current migration configuration!

btRemoveTables.label: Delete all database tables
btRemoveTables.confirmDesc: Are you sure that you want to delete all database tables that belong to the model? This can not be undone! You might want to save the database first before proceeding.
btRemoveTables.msgSuccess: Database tables removed successfully! Please restart the application.

miroPivot.colTruncationWarning: Data was truncated to the first %s columns.
miroPivot.rowTruncationWarning: Data was truncated to the first %s rows.

miroPivot.duplicateRecordDesc: The record you entered already exists.

miroPivot.errPivot: The data could not be pivoted. This could be because your data is too large.

newView.title: New view
newView.label: Please choose a name for the view.
newView.info: Axis settings are reversed for horizontal charts.

newView.maxY2: Static maximum value on secondary axis (optional)

settings.fixedColumns: Fix table columns to the left
settings.chartFontSize: Font size to use in charts

baselineComparison.errorAggregated: The baseline domain can't be aggregated. Baseline comparison has been turned off — showing raw values instead.

fileRead.title: Error reading file
fileRead.tooLarge: The file you are trying to access is too large to be displayed.

warnings.ambiguousDelim: WARNING: The delimiter of your file could not be identified uniquely. Please select manually below.

errors.noColsSelected: ERROR: You must select at least one column to import.
errors.badDelim: ERROR: Could not determine delimiter. Valid delimiters are: '%s'.
errors.duplicateCol: ERROR: Multiple selection of the same column is not supported.
errors.badEncoding: The file you uploaded is not UTF-8 encoded. Other encodings than UTF-8 are not supported!

errors.duplicateRecordsTruncated: (Only the first 10 duplicate records are displayed)

warnings.invalidSymbols: WARNING: Invalid symbols in Excel file ignored: '%s'.
warnings.skipOptionsPersistence: WARNING: Some non-empty rows were skipped. MIRO does not support options with persistence like 'skipEmpty'. Declare them as part of the symbol declaration instead.
warnings.keyValueCols: WARNING: Key=value columns are not supported by MIRO and will be ignored. Please use column headers only.
warnings.invalidSkipEmpty: WARNING: skipEmpty greater than 1 is not supported in MIRO (symbol(s): '%s'). Invalid values have been set to 1.
warnings.invalidSqueeze: WARNING: Invalid value for squeeze option (symbol(s): '%s'). Allowed values are: 1, y, 0, n. Invalid values were set to 1.
warnings.invalidOptions: WARNING: Invalid options unknown to MIRO found in index: '%s'.
warnings.scalarDeclarations: WARNING: Both scalar table declaration and single scalar declaration found in index. Single declaration is ignored if scalar is already part of the table!
warnings.invalidDsets: WARNING: Data type: 'dSet' is not supported for sets with more than one dimension (symbol(s): '%s').

errors.badFormat: ERROR: file is not a valid Excel file.
errors.indexNoSymInfo: ERROR: Could not find symbol name information in index.
errors.indexNoRangeInfo: ERROR: Could not find range information in index.
errors.indexInvalidRdim: ERROR: Symbol(s): '%s' have invalid row dimension.
errors.indexInvalidCdim: ERROR: Symbol(s): '%s' have invalid column dimensions.
errors.indexDuplicateRdim: ERROR: rowdim column could not be uniquely identified.
errors.indexDuplicateCdim: ERROR: coldim column could not be uniquely identified.
errors.indexDuplicateIgnoreCol: ERROR: ignoreColumns column could not be uniquely identified.
errors.indexDuplicateSkipEmpty: ERROR: skipEmpty column could not be uniquely identified.
errors.indexDuplicateSqueeze: ERROR: squeeze column could not be uniquely identified.
errors.indexInvalidRdimCol: ERROR: rowdim column is not integer.
errors.indexInvalidCdimCol: ERROR: coldim column is not integer.
errors.indexInvalidValues: ERROR: Invalid 'values' options found for symbol(s): '%s'. Possible options are: auto, nodata, yn, sparse, dense.
errors.symbolNotFound: ERROR: Symbol: '%s' not found in Excel file.
errors.badIndexRange: ERROR: The entered index range is invalid.
errors.invalidRecords: ERROR: Invalid records found in symbol '%s': '%s'.
errors.duplicateSymbols: ERROR: Symbol(s): '%s' has been declared multiple times. Please make sure that each symbol is declared only once.
errors.duplicateScalars: ERROR: Scalar(s): '%s' have been declared multiple times. Please make sure that each symbol is declared only once.
errors.duplicateScalarVE: ERROR: Scalar variable(s)/equation(s): '%s' have been declared multiple times. Please make sure that each symbol is declared only once.
errors.maxDimExceeded: Data exceeds maximum number of rows and/or columns supported by Excel.

invalidFileType.title: Invalid file type
invalidFileType.desc: The file you are trying to import can not be read by MIRO. Supported file types are: %s.

initErrors.title: Some errors occurred
initErrors.desc: Please fix the errors mentioned below and restart MIRO:

renderSlider.title: Incorrect input data for slider
renderSlider.desc: The value '%s' for the slider: '%s' is not of numeric type.

saveInput.title: Error saving input data
saveInput.desc: Some error occurred saving the data to the database.

readOutput.title: Error reading the results
readOutput.desc: Some error occurred reading the results that were returned from GAMS.

dataError.title: Error in data
dataError.desc: Some data error occurred. Please contact the system administrator in case this problem persists.

ddLenMismatch.title: Number of aliases and values does not match
ddLenMismatch.desc: The number of aliases for dropdown menu: '%s' does not match the number of values.

fetchDataset.title: Error reading dataset
fetchDataset.desc: Some error occurred fetching the dataset: '%s' from the database.
fetchDataset.badColName: The column(s) '%s' was not found in the dataset : '%s'
fetchDataset.noData: Dataset: '%s' could not be loaded. Please make sure the dataset actually contains data.

GAMSInput.title: Errors occurred writing input files
GAMSInput.desc: Some errors occurred writing GAMS input files.
GAMSInput.excelRead: Some error occurred reading the file: '%s'.
GAMSInput.badColName: The column(s) '%s' was not found in the dataset : '%s'
GAMSInput.noData: Dataset: '%s' could not be loaded. Please make sure the dataset actually contains data.
GAMSInput.badInputData: The GAMS input dataset: '%s' is not valid. Please check the format of the data you wish to import.
GAMSInput.writeCsv: Some error occurred writing csv file: '%s'.

GAMSOutput.title: Errors reading output files
GAMSOutput.badOutputData: The GAMS output dataset: '%s' is not valid. Please check the format of the data you wish to import.

gamsExec.title: GAMS could not be run
gamsExec.desc: Could not run GAMS. Did you forget to specify the GAMS installation path?

quotaWarning.quotaExceeded: The job could not be submitted because your quota was exceeded. Please increase your quota and try again.

sessionExpired.title: Session expired
sessionExpired.desc: The session token for communication with GAMS Engine has expired. Please log out and log in again.

jobRunning.title: Active job
jobRunning.desc: A GAMS job is currently running. You must stop or wait for this job to finish before you can run another job.
jobRunning.descAsyncSubmitting: A GAMS job is being submitted. You must wait until this job is submitted before you can run another job.
jobRunning.descAsyncSubmittingDetach: Jobs cannot be detached while being submitted.
jobRunning.descAsync: There is already a GAMS job running at the moment. Do you want to detach the current job and attach this job instead? The currently running job can still be accessed via the job list.

unzipProcessRunning.title: MIRO busy
unzipProcessRunning.desc: MIRO is still busy extracting the model files in your workspace. Please wait and try again.

errMsg.gamsTerm: Some error occurred terminating GAMS (e.g. process is already finished).

readLog.title: Error reading log file
readLog.desc: Some error occurred reading the GAMS log file.

readLst.title: Error reading listing file
readLst.desc: Some error occurred reading the GAMS listing file.
readLst.fileSize: The lst file you are trying to read is too large to be displayed. Please download the lst file to access it.
readLst.fileNotFound: The listing file could not be found.

saveScen.title: Error saving scenario
saveScen.desc: An error occurred while trying to save the scenario.

loadScen.title: Error loading scenario
loadScen.desc: Some error occurred loading the selected scenarios.
loadScen.inconsistentDataWarning: The scenario was changed while you were viewing it. Therefore, the data may not be consistent. You may want to refresh the scenario.

deleteScen.title: Error deleting scenario
deleteScen.desc: Some error occurred deleting the scenario. If this error persists please contact the system administrator.

renderTable.title: Error rendering table
renderTable.desc: Some error occurred rendering table for output data: '%s'.

renderGraph.title: Error rendering graph
renderGraph.desc: Some error occurred rendering graph for output data: '%s'.

blankScenName.title: No name entered
blankScenName.desc: Please select a valid name for the scenario you want to save.

maxScen.title: Maximum number of scenarios reached
maxScen.desc: You have reached the maximum number of scenarios that you can load concurrently. Please first remove some scenarios before you import new ones.

lockScen.title: Error setting/removing scenario lock
lockScen.desc: Some error occurred while locking or unlocking the currently active scenario.

extract.title: Error extracting archive
extract.desc: Problems extracting the archive. Please make sure you upload a valid zip file.
extract.invalidFiles: The archive you are trying to import contains invalid files. Only trace files, CSV files and GDX files allowed!

scenRead.title: Error reading files
scenRead.desc: Problems reading scenario data. If this problem persists, please contact the system administrator.

invalidJob.title: Invalid Hypercube job
invalidJob.desc: There are no valid scenarios in your archive. Please upload valid Hypercube job data.

duplicateFetch.title: Database error
duplicateFetch.desc: Problems fetching existing scenarios from database. If this problem persists, please contact the system administrator.

dbUpload.title: Database error
dbUpload.desc: Problems uploading the scenarios to the database. Please try again later.

paverFileLoad.desc: Data could not be loaded for this category.

saveGAMSLog.title: Error saving GAMS log/lst files
saveGAMSLog.noFileAccess: One or more GAMS output files (.log/.lst) could not be accessed.
saveGAMSLog.fileSizeExceeded: One or more GAMS output files (.log/.lst) exceed the maximum file size allowed to be stored.

saveAttachments.title: Problems saving attachments
saveAttachments.noFileAccess: The attachments: '%s' could not be saved because the files are not accessible.
saveAttachments.fileSizeExceeded: The attachments: '%s' could not be saved because they exceed the maximum allowed size.
saveAttachments.maxNoExceeded: The maximum number of attachments (%s) has been exceeded.

invalidSymbolsDialog.title: Invalid configuration
invalidSymbolsDialog.desc: Some graphics and/or widgets have been configured for symbols that are no longer part of your GAMS/MIRO data contract or are hidden. Do you want to remove them from your configuration? Note that this cannot be undone! Graphic configuration for invalid symbol(s): '%s'. Widget configuration for invalid symbol(s): '%s'.

uiR.restartRequired: Note: For these changes to take effect, you must restart the Configuration Mode!

ui.title: General settings
ui.descriptionPivotcompare: These settings serve as default values for the user, but they can be adjusted at any time during a session.
ui.headerTabSymlinks: Use output data as input data

modalDialog.title: Error copying image
modalDialog.content: A problem occurred copying image. If this problem persists, please contact a system administrator.

customCss.label: Include a custom CSS file
customCss.tooltip: The file must be named 'custom.css' and located in the static_<modelname> directory.

maxTabsExpanded.title: Max. number tabs before collapsing tabs under More» drop-down tab

pageTitle.label: Application title
pageTitle.tooltip: The title is visible in the browser tab

scen.label: Default scenario comparison mode
choices: Split view (suited for 2 scenarios to compare)
Tab view (suited for > 2 scenarios to compare)
Pivot view (suited for > 2 scenarios to compare)

defaultScenName.checkbox: Load a default scenario on startup
defaultScenName.tooltip: Allows you to pre-populate tables and widgets with data when starting MIRO
defaultScenName.label: Name of the default scenario

args.label: Specify extra command line arguments that GAMS/Python will be called with

symlinks.label: Add symbol link (results that can be used as input data)

overwriteSheetOrder.input: Order of input symbol tabs (modify via drag & drop)
overwriteSheetOrder.output: Order of output symbol tabs (drag & drop)

hiddenOutputSymbols.label: Output symbols that should not be displayed but can be used in graphs etc.

hiddenOutputScalars.label: Output scalars that should not be displayed in the scalars table but can be used in graphs etc.

mirologfile.label: Include custom log file?
mirologfile.tooltip: Enter the name of the MIRO log file (minimum 3 characters). Otherwise, leave this field empty.
mirologfile.miroLogExclusiveError: Only one log file can be parsed for MIRO log syntax. Therefore, only stdout will be parsed, but the MIRO log will still be displayed.

general.mirologStdout: Should the standard log file (process stdout) be parsed for MIRO log syntax?

readme.label: README File
readme.readmeTooltip: A README file is displayed in the input section as an individual start page

dialogEdit.title: Readme editor
dialogEdit.msgErrSave: Problems writing the README file. Check whether you have sufficient write permissions in your model directory.

saveDuration.label: Duration the GAMS log and lst files are stored in the database (in days).

decimal.label: Number of decimal places used for rounding numerical values (global setting).
decimal.tooltip: Affects all output tables, Big Data input tables and the table in the Batch Load module. - Open documentation.

logo.label: Upload a custom logo for your MIRO app

actStrict.label: Launch app in strict mode? This results in throwing error messages instead of accepting possibly faulty user entries.

actUpload.title: Enables the user to import local data into a sandbox scenario
actUpload.label: Enable local data upload

actShareScen.label: Enable scenario sharing between different users

actAttach.title: Can be files of any format. MIRO distinguishes between two types of attachments: attachments that can be seen and read by your GAMS model and files that can not be seen.
actAttach.label: Allow user to add attachments to scenarios

aggregate.title: If not activated, each input widget is displayed in a separate tab.
aggregate.label: Should all input widgets (slider, dropdown menu, etc.) be aggregated on a single tab?

parent.label: Include parent directory of the model folder in your model runs (e.g. because several models share files)?

meta.title: Metadata contains information about the user name, the scenario name and the creation time of the scenario
meta.label: Include a metadata sheet in the Excel file (when exporting a scenario)

empty.title: Sheets can be empty e.g. when the exported scenario only contains input data.
empty.label: Include empty sheets in the Excel file

downloadTempFiles.label: Allow access to the temporary working directory

auto.label: Generate graphs for each input symbol automatically (pivot tool)

ui.title: Table settings
ui.tableTooltip: Input tables are configured in the widgets section.

hot.readonly: Restrict editing of tables? If activated, tables can not be modified by the user.
hot.colwidth: Width of a single (non-streched) column. Leave empty or 0 to set the default value.
hot.enable: Enable table context menu (accessible via right mouse click).

pagelength.label: Number of items to display per page

decimals.label: Number of decimal places to display

buttons.title: If a symbol contains multiple table pages, using an export button only affects the currently visible table page!
buttons.select: Select buttons to use. Note: All button functions only affect the visible table page.

removeDialog.title: Please confirm
removeDialog.message: Are you sure that you want to reset the existing configuration for this symbol? This cannot be undone!

symbol.noGraph: Only display the table and no graphic for this symbol

saveJson.warnContent: According to the configuration, no graphic should be displayed for the symbol '%s'. A graph configuration already exists for this symbol. Do you want to overwrite this configuration? This cannot be undone!

ui.title: Configure input widgets
ui.noSymbolMsg: No GAMS symbol has been tagged for use in MIRO
ui.noWidgetMsg: No widget has been configured yet
ui.noWidgetConfigMsg: Currently, there is no widget configured for this symbol
ui.optionConfigMsg: Info: The symbol you selected is a GAMS option: %s
ui.doubledashConfigMsg: Info: The symbol you selected is a double-dash parameter: %s
ui.widgetExternallyDefinedMsg: Info: The symbol you selected is already defined by the widget of symbol: '%s'. Configuring a widget for this symbol can still be useful (e.g. for the Hypercube module or the Batch Load module).
ui.inputSymbolTooltip: Select input symbol to create a widget for
ui.tableTooltip: Select the input symbol whose table you want to configure
ui.widgetGoTooltip: Name of the GAMS option (e.g. 'LP' or 'OptCR')
ui.alias: Name of the widget tab (no live preview)
ui.pivotColsRestriction: Note: It is not possible to add or delete columns in the symbol table if it is set to readonly or displayed as a heatmap.
ui.notConfigurable: The widget configuration found in your JSON file is currently not supported for the selected symbol type in Configuration Mode! This does not imply that the configuration is invalid. Symbol: '%s'; Configured widget type: '%s'

validate.val1: The alias of the element must not be empty!
validate.val2: The name of the double-dash parameter must not be empty!
validate.val3: The name of the GAMS option must not be empty!
validate.val7: The default value must be a number in the range [min, max]!
validate.val8: The tick identifier must be boolean!
validate.val9: The step size must be a number!
validate.val10: Your dropdown menu must have the same number of aliases as choices or no aliases at all!
validate.val11: The default value must be one of the choices you specified!
validate.val16: The default date must be after the start date!
validate.val17: The default date must be before the end date!
validate.val18: The earliest date must be before the latest date!
validate.val19: Minimum length for custom date format is 1!
validate.val24: The start date must be after the earliest date!
validate.val25: The end date must be before the latest date!
validate.val26: The start date must be after the earliest date!
validate.val27: The end date must be before the latest date!
validate.val28: The earliest date must be before the latest date!
validate.val29: Minimum length for custom date format is 1!
validate.val30: The start date must be before the end date!
validate.val31: The earliest date must be before the latest date!
validate.val32: The readonly identifier must be boolean!
validate.val33: The heatmap identifier must be boolean!
validate.val34: Some columns you selected to be readonly do not exist in the symbol currently selected!
validate.val36: The group name must be at least 1 character long.
validate.val37: Each group must have at least 2 members and every element may only appear in a single group!
validate.val37a: Each group must have at least 1 member and every element may only appear in a single group!
validate.val38: At least one choice has to be specified!
validate.val39: No space allowed in the name!
validate.val42: The minimum value must be lower than the maximum value!
validate.val43: For a slider range 2 default values need to be defined!
validate.val45: The name of the command line parameter must be at least 1 character long.
validate.val46: Please specify command line arguments and values separately.
validate.val47: Source and target symbol must have the same dimension!
validate.val48: The minimum step size must not be less than zero.
validate.val49: The script identifier must not be empty and must only contain alphanumeric characters!
validate.val50: The script identifier must be unique!
validate.val55: Only one item can be selectable in the dropdown menu if only the element text is communicated with GAMS.
validate.val56: An attachment with this file name already exists!
validate.val57: The file name contains invalid characters. Attachments in subdirectories are not supported!
validate.val58: The decimal separator and the thousand grouping separator must not be identical!
validate.val59: The GAMS symbol: %s is declared as table. This causes the last column to be pivoted in MIRO. MIRO pivot cannot be used with already pivoted symbols. Please declare the symbol as a parameter instead.
validate.val60: Each group member may only appear in a single group!
validate.val61: The GAMS option must not be one of the reserved options: '%s'.

table.label: Label (Markdown is supported)
table.type: Select the type of table you want to use
table.colWidthsTooltip: The Configuration Mode supports the specification of one column width for all columns of the table. To specify the width of each column individually, the JSON configuration file must be modified manually. - Open documentation
table.customColWidths: Custom column width configuration found in JSON file (not supported in Configuration Mode). Note that changing column widths in Configuration Mode overwrites custom widths.
table.fixedColumnsLeft: Fix columns that are not pivoted?
table.colDecimals: Specify the number of decimal places for the column: '%s'
table.dropdownColsDesc: An input table can be configured so that the cells are not freely editable by the user, but can only be modified via a drop-down menu. This option is not available in the Configuration Mode but needs to be configured manually. Read more here:

slider.label: Choose a label
slider.dep: Select symbol and header to depend upon
slider.minStepTooltip: Only relevant in Hypercube module. If empty, the step size is used. - Open documentation
slider.hcube: Expand to slider range when submitting Hypercube jobs

sliderrange.label: Choose a label
sliderrange.dep: Select symbol and header to depend upon
sliderrange.hcube: Expand automatically when submitting Hypercube jobs

dropdown.label: Choose a label

choiceDep.label: Select symbol and header to depend upon

dropdown.clearValue: Communicate as element text with GAMS
dropdown.clearValueTooltip: Causes element label to be an empty string. - Open documentation
dropdown.hcube: Expand to multidropdown menu when submitting Hypercube jobs

checkbox.label: Choose a label
checkbox.hcube: Expand to multidropdown menu when submitting Hypercube jobs

date.label: Choose a label
date.format: Choose how you want the date to be formatted.

startview.label: What date range should be displayed per default?

weekstart.label: What day shall be the start of the week?

date.daysDisabled: Select weekdays that you want to disable
date.autoclose: Should datepicker be closed immediately when a date is selected?
date.hcube: Expand to daterange selector when submitting Hypercube jobs

daterange.label: Choose a label
daterange.format: Choose how you want the date to be formatted.

startview.label: What date range is shown per default?

weekstart.label: What day shall be the start of the week?

daterange.separator: Select the separator between start and end date selector
daterange.autoclose: Should datepicker be closed immediately when a date range is selected?
daterange.hcube: Expand automatically when submitting Hypercube jobs

textinput.label: Choose a label
textinput.clearValue: Communicate as element text with GAMS
textinput.clearValueTooltip: Causes element label to be an empty string. - Open documentation

removeDialog.title: Please confirm
removeDialog.message: Are you sure that you want to delete the existing configuration for this symbol? This cannot be undone!

database.title: Database management
database.infoPostgres: You are using GAMS MIRO Desktop with a PostgreSQL database backend. The database used has the name: %s and is located at: %s. To back up your database, read here.
database.infoSQLite: You are using GAMS MIRO Desktop with a SQLite database backend. The database used is located at: %s.
database.backupWrapper: You want to create a backup of the database?
database.removeWrapper: You want to remove all the tables that belong to your model (e.g. because the schema changed)?

ui.title: Configure graphs
ui.label: Label (Markdown is supported)
ui.localInput: Upload a GDX file or an Excel spreadsheet with data that will be used for preview purposes
ui.chartTitle: Choose a title for your chart
ui.height: Choose a height for your chart (px) (no live preview)
ui.toggleLeft: Switch left panel to full screen
ui.toggleRight: Switch right panel to full screen
ui.previewErrorObs: An error occurred in an observer: '%s'

validate.val1: Could not set range for x axis. Check for correct data format!
validate.custom1: Could not parse additional options. Please make sure that you use valid JSON syntax!
validate.pieValues: The selected symbol has too many values to be displayed as a pie chart. The maximum number of values that can be displayed in a pie chart is 100.
validate.tableNeeded: A symbol that is to be configured as a map must be declared as a GAMS table, since multiple value columns are required (e.g. latitude and longitude information).

errMsg.errContent1: No valid datasets were found. Please upload a properly formatted Excel or gdx file with data.
errMsg.scalarConfig: The configuration for input scalars is done in '

axisOptions.title: Axis label
axisOptions.range: Set axis range. The format has to match the data format. When not specified, a default is used.

chartOptions.xdata: What should be plotted on the x axis?
chartOptions.color: Should a dimension of the symbol be pivoted (grouped for plotting)? Note that resulting colors are only valid, when no other line or marker colors are set
chartOptions.symbol: Select a dimension to map to different symbols. No marker symbol must be set.

options.title: Options
options.paperBgColor: What background color shall the paper have?
options.plotBgColor: What background color shall the plot have?
options.fixedHeight: Fix chart height (px) - Leave empty or 0 for default
options.fixedWidth: Fix chart width (px) - Leave empty or 0 for default
options.outType: Show graphic and data table in split screen? (no live preview)

barOptions.width: Domain that is used to select different bar widths

valueboxOptions.width: Maximum number of boxes per row (no preview)
valueboxOptions.icon: Specify an icon for the valuebox (optional).

animationOptions.title: Animation options
animationOptions.transition: Duration of the smooth transition between frames (in milliseconds).
animationOptions.redraw: Trigger a redraw of the plot at completion of the transition? (this may significantly impact performance, but may be necessary to update graphical elements that can't be transitioned.)
animationOptions.mode: How shall new animate calls interact with currently-running animations?
animationOptions.noAnimation: No domain selected for animation (category: Y data).

animationSliderOptions.label: Label to appear on the slider
animationSliderOptions.fontColor: What font color should be used for the slider label?

normChoices: Number of occurances/ Bin interval size
histOptions.barmode: How do you want the bars to be displayed?
histOptions.alpha: Opacity of bars (only valid if no bar color is set)

dygraphsOptions.previewError: No scalar indices found in your data.
dygraphsOptions.xdata: What index do you want to plot on the x-axis?
dygraphsOptions.ydataGeneral: Dimension to pivot selected. Further options related to y-data can be set under 'General'
dygraphsOptions.color: Should a dimension of the symbol be pivoted (grouped for plotting)?

rngSelOpts.title: Range selector options
rngSelOpts.activate: Do you want to see a range selector?
rngSelOpts.height: How high should it be (in px)?
rngSelOpts.retainDateWindow: Should current date range be kept when graph is redrawn?
rngSelOpts.keepMouseZoom: Do you still want to be able to zoom with the mouse?
rngSelOpts.fillColor: What fill color should be used?
rngSelOpts.strokeColor: What stroke color should be used?

generalOpts.title: General options
generalOpts.stepPlot: Do you want a step plot?
generalOpts.stemPlot: Do you want a stem plot?
generalOpts.fillGraph: Should the area underneath the graph be filled?

axisOptions.title: Label
axisOptions.valueRange: Set axis range. The format has to match the data format. When not specified, a default is used.

highOpts.title: Highlighting options
highOpts.activate: Would you like to see highlighting effects?
highOpts.circleSize: What shall the circle size be (in px)?
highOpts.seriesBackgroundAlpha: Choose the opacity of the background
highOpts.strokeBorderWidth: Draw a border around highlighted lines
highOpts.hideOnMouseOut: Hide highlighting effects when mouse is moved out of chart?

legend.title: Legend options
legend.showZeroValues: Show zero value labels in the legend
legend.hideOnMouseOut: Hide legend when mouse is moved out of chart

leafletOptions.hideGroups: Select groups that should be hidden on startup

timevisOptions.custom: Add a vertical bar at a time point that can be dragged by the user (no preview available)

options.title: Gantt chart options
options.showZoom: Include 'Zoom In' / 'Zoom Out' buttons? Zoom can also be done via ctrl + mouse wheel
options.zoomFactor: Zoom factor? Zooming out from 20 days with a zoom factor of 1 will results in showing 40 days. No preview available.
options.fit: Fit all data on the timeline when the timeline initializes? Otherwise, the timeline will be set to show the current date.
options.showCurrentTime: Show a vertical bar at the current time

miroPivotOptions.externalDefaultViewName: Name of the view to use as default
miroPivotOptions.infoMsg: Please use directly the preview on the right side to configure the default view. This includes settings (%s) and view options (%s)
miroPivotOptions.hideEmptyColsSwitch: Enable switch to hide empty columns by default
miroPivotOptions.emptyUEL: UEL, which indicates a missing value (must not be empty string)
miroPivotOptions.emptyUELTooltip: The switch to hide empty columns (located in the pivot table settings menu) allows to hide empty columns in a table. This is especially useful in a data cube where individual views can have empty dimensions.
miroPivotOptions.fixedColumnsTooltip: If this option is activated, the columns of the pivot table are fixed to the left side of the table and remain visible when scrolling horizontally.
miroPivotOptions.infoMsgDummyData: Currently the preview uses dummy data. This means that the filters will have dummy values. If you want to change these, you have to edit the JSON configuration file manually.

pivotOptions.rows: Prepopulate rows of the pivot table
pivotOptions.cols: Prepopulate columns of the pivot table
pivotOptions.vals: Name of the column to aggregate.

options.title: Pivot table options
options.locale: Localization options. A change from 'en' to another language will cause the configuration of the used graphic to be lost.
options.subtotals: Should subtotal plugin be used? For examples, see:

customOptions.options: Additional options passed to renderer functions
customOptions.additionalData: Additional datasets to communicate with the custom renderer

filterOptions.filter: Should one domain of the symbol be selectable via a dropdown menu?
filterOptions.label: Label of the filter (no live preview)
filterOptions.multiple: Should several elements be selectable as filter at the same time? (No live preview for single dropdown menu available)
filterOptions.date: The data in the column to be filtered contain dates (times). No live preview available!

saveJson.warnContent: A graph configuration already exists for symbol: '%s'. Do you want to overwrite this configuration? This cannot be undone!

removeDialog.title: Please confirm
removeDialog.message: Are you sure that you want to delete the existing graph configuration for this symbol? This cannot be undone!

addInputGroup.groupSameTabIn: Show all symbols on the same tab
addInputGroup.groupSameTabInNoCols: Number of symbols next to each other
addInputGroup.groupSameTabWidget: Show all widgets side by side on the same tab

addOutputGroup.groupSameTabOut: Show all symbols on the same tab
addOutputGroup.groupSameTabOutNoCols: Number of symbols next to each other

addSymlink.target: Name of the input symbol to link to

addScript.title: Script alias (displayed in UI)
addScript.outFile: Name of the output file (including file extension)
addScript.markdown: Output file is a Markdown file

addOutAttach.file: Name of the file to attach
addOutAttach.exec: Allow model to read this file
addOutAttach.error: Display an error if the file is not found

addDyEvent.dyDyEventTrue: Set a date for the event (yyyy-mm-dd)
addDyEvent.label: Label

addDyLimit.dyDyLimitTrue: Set a numeric value for the limit
addDyLimit.limit: Set a numeric value for the limit
addDyLimit.label: Label

addDyShading.axis: Axis where shading shall be applied to

addLeafletMarkers.groupName: Choose a group name for these markers
addLeafletMarkers.label: Choose a label
addLeafletMarkers.labelcolor: Choose a font color for the label
addLeafletMarkers.labelbgcolor: Choose a background color for the label
addLeafletMarkers.labelsize: Choose a font size for the label (in px)

addLeafletFlows.leafletFlows: Select latitude data where flow originates
addLeafletFlows.lng: Select longitude data where flow originates
addLeafletFlows.lat1: Select latitude data where flow ends
addLeafletFlows.lng1: Select longitude data where flow ends
addLeafletFlows.label: Choose a unique label for each flow (optional)
addLeafletFlows.labelTooltip: A suitable configuration for a label is to specify the originator and the recipient for each flow - open documentation

addLeafletMinicharts.leafletMinicharts: Select latitude data where minichart should be plotted
addLeafletMinicharts.lng: Select longitude data where minichart should be plotted
addLeafletMinicharts.width: Choose the maximal width of the created elements
addLeafletMinicharts.height: Choose the maximal height of the created elements
addLeafletMinicharts.variableSize: Should the size of the charts be proportional to the values?
addLeafletMinicharts.showlabels: Should values be displayed above chart elements?
addLeafletMinicharts.transitionTime: Select the duration of transitions when a property of a chart is updated (in milliseconds)

addPieDataEl.chartName: Name of element (only relevant if multiple pie charts are displayed)

addBarDataEl.chartYdatabar: What should be plotted on the y axis?
addBarDataEl.color: Select bar color (delete color for automated selection)

addScatterDataEl.chartYdata: What should be plotted on the y axis?
addScatterDataEl.legend: Show legend (this option could be overwritten by the by the global show legend option)
addScatterDataEl.frame: Use a data dimension for animation (as frames)

addLineDataEl.chartYdata: What should be plotted on the y axis?
addLineDataEl.legend: Show legend? (this option could be overwritten by the by the global show legend option)
addLineDataEl.frame: Use a data dimension for animation (as frames)?

addBubbleDataEl.chartYdata: What should be plotted on the y axis?
addBubbleDataEl.colorCheckFalse: Select a domain on which the color should depend on.
addBubbleDataEl.sizemode: How should the size be measured?
addBubbleDataEl.legend: Show legend (this option could be overwritten by the by the global show legend option)
addBubbleDataEl.frame: Use a data dimension for animation (as frames)?

addDyDataEl.chartYdata: What index do you want to plot on the y-axis?
addDyDataEl.label: Label
addDyDataEl.stepPlot: Draw series as a step plot
addDyDataEl.stemPlot: Draw series as a stem plot

addTimevisDataEl.type: The type of the item? Note: Types box and point need only a start date, types range and background need both a start and end date.
addTimevisDataEl.title: Add a title for each item, displayed when hovering the mouse over it?
addTimevisDataEl.group: Group ID. When a group is provided, all items with the same group are placed on one line.
addTimevisDataEl.subgroup: Subgroup ID. Groups all items within a group per subgroup, and positions them on the same height instead of stacking them on top of each other.
addTimevisDataEl.grouptitle: Add a title for each group, displayed when hovering the mouse over it?
addTimevisDataEl.subgrouporder: Order the subgroups by a field name. By default, groups are ordered by first-come, first-show.

themeColors.title: Custom theme colors
themeColors.primaryTooltip: Main brand color. It is used most frequently across the application to highlight primary actions and guide user focus.
themeColors.secondaryTooltip: The secondary color is used to accent the interface, differentiate content, indicate less prominent actions, and serves as the color of the main buttons in the application.
themeColors.alertTooltip: The alert color is applied to buttons that trigger actions like remove, clear, or delete, emphasizing caution and drawing attention to potentially irreversible changes.
themeColors.consoleTooltip: Used for displaying output in log and listing files within the GAMS interaction section.
themeColors.widgetBgDarkTooltip: The widget color is used for interactive UI elements such as dropdowns, tables, sliders, and other controls.

themeButtons.saveLocalDesc: An app-specific theme is embedded in the app and overrides all other theme settings. Once the app is exported, its colors can't be changed.
themeButtons.saveGlobalDesc: A global theme is centrally stored and applies to all apps present on the device. It is selected in the MIRO Desktop Preferences.
themeButtons.removeColorsDesc: Deletes any existing app-specific theme configuration, if present.
themeButtons.saveGlobalModalText: A file called '%s' already exists in the GAMS MIRO workspace.
themeButtons.saveGlobalModalNoteDesc: You can now select the color theme 'Custom' in the MIRO Desktop preferences.
themeButtons.removeColorsText: This will remove all 'themeColors' from your configuration file.

miroServerColors.title: MIRO Server colors
miroServerColors.titleTooltip: Colors for the MIRO Server login screen, the app overview page, etc.
miroServerColors.primaryTooltip: Main brand color. It is used to highlight primary actions and guide user focus.
